problem_text:
Let G be a group of permutations of the set of positive integers N isomorphic to the additive group of rational numbers. Must there be an element g ∈ G such that the set {a − ag | a ∈ N} is infinite?
N. M. Suchkov
answer: Yes, it must (N. M. Suchkov, A. A. Shlepkin, D. A. Taysnyov, Siberian Math. J., 65 (2024), 1390–1394).
